revision.text:
The '''Value of Lost Load''' ('''VoLL''') is the estimated amount that customers receiving [[Electricity generation|electricity]] with [[Electricity market|firm contracts]] would be willing to pay to avoid a [[Power outage|disruption]] in their electricity service.<ref>Vassilopoulos, P., “Models for the Identification of Market Power in Wholesale Electricity Markets”, Industrial Organization, D.E.A 129, September 2003 pp 46 - 47.</ref> The value of these losses can be expressed as a customer damage function (CDF). A CDF is defined<ref>Sullivan, M.J. and Keane, D.M., “Outage Cost Estimation Guidebook”, EPRI Research Project 2878-04 Final Report, December 1995, pp 1-4.</ref> as:
Loss ($/kW) = <big><big>'''ƒ'''</big></big> (duration, season, time of day, notice)
Based on the calculated outage cost, a CDF can be obtained for various customer groups. Typically, there are three distinct groups of customers: residential, small and medium commercial/industry and large commercial/industrial.<ref>Sullivan, M.J. and Keane, D.M., “Outage Cost Estimation Guidebook”, EPRI Research Project 2878-04 Final Report, December 1995, pp 8-13.</ref> Figure 1 below illustrates the incremental CDFs of these three groups.
[[Image:Voll cdf.JPG|frame|'''Figure 1: Example Customer Damage Functions''']]
The CDF relates the magnitude of customer losses (per kW interrupted) for a given duration of a power outage. While the general shapes of all three curves are similar, the magnitude of loss varies dramatically depending on the customer’s size. Based on VoLL data from an EGAT survey in March and April 2000,<ref>“Electricity Outage Cost Study”, http://www.eppo.go.th/power/ERI-study-E/ERI-ExeSummary-E.html, 19 November 2005.</ref> it was estimated that the customers’ costs in the first hour for residential customers was Baht 11.45/kW. For large commercial/industrial (C/I) and small & medium C/I customers, the cost in the first hour was Baht 29.55/kW and Baht 89.50 /kW respectively. Further research from [[Electric Power Research Institute|EPRI]] indicates that residential customers’ cost tend to peak at USD 1.50/kW in the first hour and falls of to USD 0.46/kW in subsequent hours. On the other hand, large C/I and small & medium C/I suffer much higher losses of USD 10/kW and USD 38/kW respectively in the first hour. This falls to USD 4/kW and USD 9/kW respectively in the subsequent hours.
The CDF predicts the loss per interrupted kW based on factors that influence the outage. The CDF is usually calculated based on defined market segments such as residential, commercial, and industrial. This is done because there are large variations of costs across the utility market segments. However, in a large area it is a normal practice that the interruption cost is aggregated to represent a general picture of the load losses. The aggregated interruption cost is called the composite CDF.
== References == <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.daniel-sen.com/downloads/MEng%20Dissertation%20%28Daniel%20Andrew%20Sen%29.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1 MEng Dissertation by Daniel Andrew Sen entitled "Stratification & Sampling of Electricity Consumer Data for Outage Cost Determination"]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Value Of Lost Load}} [[Category:Power engineering]] [[Category:Energy economics]] [[Category:Electric power distribution]]

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Yb:LuVO<sub>4</sub>}} '''Yb:LuVO<sub>4</sub>''' ([[Ytterbium]]-[[Dopant#Lasing media|doped]] [[Lutetium]] [[Vanadate]])is an [[active laser medium]]. The peak [[absorption cross section]] for the [[Polarization (waves)|pi-polarization]] is 8.42×10<sup>−20</sup> cm² at 985 [[1 E-9 m|nm]], and the [[stimulated emission]] [[Cross section (physics)|cross section]] at 1020 [[1 E-9 m|nm]] is 1.03×10<sup>−20</sup> cm².
==See also== *[[List of laser types]]
==Further reading== * J. Liu, X. Mateos, H. Zhang, J. Wang, M. Jiang, U. Griebner, and V. Petrov, "[http://ol.osa.org/abstract.cfm?id=86362 Continuous-wave laser operation of Yb:LuVO4]," Opt. Lett. '''30''', 3162-3164 (2005). * Higuchi, M, Shimizu, T, Takahashi, J, et al. "[http://sdos.ejournal.ascc.net/cgi-bin/sciserv.pl?collection=journals&journal=00220248&issue=v283i1-2&article=100_gortyszmatsp Growth of RE : LuVO4 (RE = Nd, Tm, Yb) single crystals by the floating zone method and their spectroscopic properties]," J CRYST GROWTH '''283''' 100-107 (2005).
